p: Mango pulp contains various organic acids including citric acid, malic acid, oxalic acid, succinic acid, ascorbic acid, and tartaric acid. Organic acids are generally weak acids with low molecular weight. The presence of organic acids provides fruits their characteristic tastes and flavors, playing an important role in their organoleptic quality [ 37]. Among others, citric acid, malic acid, and succinic acid are the major organic acids present in various types of Indian mangoes [ 49].
